page_content: The page discusses the regulation and implementation of a new educational material called "Schauplatz Ethik" for primary and secondary schools in the Canton of Zürich. It outlines the development process, content, and structure of the material, focusing on ethical and philosophical questions.

The page outlines the responsibilities of the Asylkoordination department in the Canton of Zürich, focusing on the placement and support of asylum seekers and refugees, including their integration, healthcare, financial assistance, and return counseling.

The page details an evaluation of German as a Second Language (DaZ) teaching materials in the Canton of Zürich, focusing on their compatibility with the Lehrplan 21. It includes assessments of specific materials, recommendations for improvements, and a decision by the Bildungsrat regarding the development of new teaching materials.

The page provides information about educational grants in the Canton of Zürich, including the application process, eligibility criteria, alternatives to cantonal grants, and contact details. It also mentions the revised scholarship law effective from January 1, 2021, and the current processing times for applications.
The page is not accessible, and a 404 error is displayed.

The page provides detailed instructions on how to order official document certifications from the Canton of Zürich for use abroad. It includes step-by-step guidance, fees, contact information, and specific procedures for different types of documents.

The page details the responsibilities and functions of the Cantonal Integration Office and city-specific integration departments in Zürich and Winterthur. It includes information on coordination, consultation, support, project promotion, and specific integration programs, such as the Cantonal Integration Program (KIP) and the Integrationsagenda in the Canton of Zürich.

The page refers to a decision by the Canton of Zürich's Baudirektion regarding the "Migrationsprojekt MIT16," which involves the renewal of PC clients and software. The decision document (RRB-2015-0945) is available for download.
